brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effects of heated pool group exercises for
      patients with inflammatory rheumatic diseases with regard to symptoms (pain, fatigue,
      stiffness and ability to carry out daily activities).

clinical_study.brief_title: Heated Pool Exercise Groups for Patients With Rheumatic Diseases

detailed_description.textblock:
The patients receive text messages on mobile phones twice a week for circa 40 weeks. The
      text messages ask for pain, fatigue, stiffness and ability to carry out everyday activities.
      The patients should respond with a number from 0 to 10, where 0 is no symptoms/no hindering
      of activity and 10 is worst symptoms/worst hindering of activity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Referral from a medical doctor to group exercises in heated pool

          -  Inflammatory rheumatic joint disease

          -  > 18 years

          -  Stable disease

          -  Mobile phone owner

          -  Understand and use text messages on mobile phones

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Independent living

          -  Joint surgery previous to the study start

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with inflammatory rheumatic joint diseases with a medical referral to group
        exercises in heated pool.

intervention.description: Group exercise in heated pool one hour per week for 12 weeks.

facility.name: National resource center for rehabilitation in rheumatology

clinical_study.official_title: Better Everyday-life With Heated Pool Exercise Groups for Patients With Inflammatory Rheumatic Diseases

overall_official.affiliation: National resource centre for rehabilitation in rheumatology

primary_outcome.description: How much do your health problems affect your ability to conduct daily activities? The outcome is assessed on a ten-point rating scale ranging from zero to ten with "0" representing "no affect" and "10" representing "extreme affect".
How much pain do you have at present? The outcome is measured on a ten-point numeric rating scale (NRS) ranging from zero to ten with "0" representing "no pain" and "10" representing "extreme pain".
How much fatigue do you have at present? The outcome is assesses on a ten-point rating scale ranging from zero to ten with "0" representing "no fatigue" and "10" representing "extreme fatigue"
How much stiffness do you have at present? The outcome is assessed on a ten-point numeric rating scale with "0" representing "no stiffness" and "10" representing "extreme stiffness".

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
